tif

Class TifMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.TifMetadata
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Metadata<DirectoryIFD>, java.lang.Iterable<DirectoryIFD>, TifMetadataProvider

    public class TifMetadata
extends java.lang.Object
implements TifMetadataProvider
    A concrete metadata strategy for managing a collection of metadata, including EXIF and potentially XMP metadata. These metadata segments are typically found in TIFF and JPEG files. This class stores and provides access to various Image File Directories (IFDs), such as the primary IFD, and EXIF sub-IFD.

    This class implements the TifMetadataProvider interface, defining the specific behaviours required for managing EXIF data, including checking for the presence of the EXIF sub-directory.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified byte order is null

      • addDirectory

        public void addDirectory(DirectoryIFD directory)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        directory - the DirectoryIFD to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the provided directory is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the byte order is not in an deterministic state. Be sure to invoke the parameterised constructor first

      • hasExifData

        public boolean hasExifData()
        Checks if the collection contains an EXIF directory, specifically, the EXIF sub-IFD. Note: This method re-declares the default method defined in the parent interface to poly-morphically enable specialised behaviour.
        Specified by:
        hasExifData in interface Metadata<DirectoryIFD>
        Returns:
        true if an EXIF sub-IFD is present, otherwise false

      • hasXmpData

        Specified by:
        hasXmpData in interface Metadata<DirectoryIFD>
        Returns:
        true if XMP metadata is present, otherwise false

      • extractDate

        public java.util.Date extractDate()
        Attempts to extract the most authoritative creation date available.

        The extraction follows a priority waterfall:

        1. EXIF Sub-IFD DateTimeOriginal
        2. XMP EXIF Schema DateTimeOriginal
        3. XMP General Schema CreateDate
        Specified by:
        extractDate in interface Metadata<DirectoryIFD>
        Returns:
        the extracted Date, or null if no valid timestamp exists
